[h1]This review was made on 11/15/25, it will be majorly disappointing if none of these suggestions were not implemented since my review, and you likely should not buy this unless I have updated my review saying these features have been implemented, which I will do if the developers do update the software to include my suggestions.[/h1]
[olist]
[*][u][b]All these DLC's should be $8 or less, $15, as I and many others in these reviews agree, is too much.[/b][/u]

[*][u][b]BANNING MODDING IS BAD, ALLOW MODDING, OR AT LEAST CREATE AN OFFICIAL STEAM WORKSHOP.[/b][/u]

[*]They should have at minimum [u][b]50 animations[/b][/u] attached to them if not, more, some of these these animations don't have enough variety to make them continually interesting or be worth the $15 pricetag.

[*][u][b]You can only have one character at a time[/b][/u], this is genuinely absurd for the amount of DLC this game has, and [b]you should be able to have clones of your character around your monitor, not just one[/b].

[*]I'm unsure if it's for all of them, but my character, Ame, [b]doesn't have English audio, just Japanese, with no English captions[/b], this is absurd for a $15 product, [b][u]if I don't get English audio, I would at least like there to be captions translating what the Japanese audio is saying.[/u]

[*]Add a toggle in the settings that puts the software on performance mode, and [b]optimizes the application AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE[/b] to not take up resources on the computer.

[*]Make a toggle so that a character can randomly choose to sit between a specified interval and the chance that they'll sit. The characters already randomly do sit, but there is no customization to it, and [b][u]they seem to get back up 10 seconds after they sit, which is too short.[/u]

[*]Character's voicelines get interrupted by other voicelines, either fix this or add a toggle in the settings so that they won't get interrupted by a new voiceline.

[*]These should take inspiration from Shimeji (which are mostly free mind you, and better), I've provided a list below of some features Shimeji do and more, of which this program should also implement these features.



[h3]There should in general be more features for the (what should be $8) pricetag, more features like:[/h3]

[*][u][b]A toggle to allow characters to freely walk horizontally on your desktop[/b][/u] (they don't do this already somehow, they are [u][b]ABSOLUTELY STATIONARY.[/b][/u])

[*]A toggle to allow characters to walk between your computer monitors.

[*][b]Create a toggle so that characters can play animations to the music or videos that are being played on your PC[/b], a toggle for this specifically would be nice as some people might not want this happening constantly.

[*]Have different moods toggleable in the settings for your characters.

[*]Give each character little infinitely replayable games to interact with involving them, this would be simple, fun, and justify the pricetag.

[*]Make a toggle to turn off interactability that way you can keep it open with games on, this is a product on Steam after all, people are going to be using this while playing games and it's annoying to have to drag a character every time you want to click something behind them.

[*]Create several random animations for the character when an hour passes on the clock, you can even give voicelines to them like "It's getting late" with them visually looking bummed out or "It's too early in the morning for me..." with them visually looking sleepy.

[*]Make a slider to make the characters semi-transparent, so that people who want to have the character but also see behind them can do so.

[*]There should be a toggle to turn off shadows.

[*]I'm unsure if this is for all the characters, but for my Ame character, if I put her attached to the right side of the screen, she's still visible on my right monitor and completely still, meaning the animation of her on the right side of the monitor doesn't have a looping idle animation when it's off-screen. This should be fixed, and the application should just detect if the application is genuinely off-screen and disable the animation if it is indeed displaying on a different monitor to save on resources.

[*]The alarm sound should start out quiet and gradually get louder, also you should manually have to click the character to stop the alarm.
[/olist]

[h2]Developers, this should be your checklist on what to change about this software, please, genuinely go through and implement every one of these suggestions, [b]as motivation I will personally gift a DLC to someone if you do, paying you $15. And I'm inclined to ask people to also volunteer in the replies of this review (if you want, obviously you by no means have to) to also volunteer to gift a DLC if you do implement all these changes, that way hypothetically if you do implement everything in this checklist, then 10 people collectively would purchase your product for $150 or more.

Thank you for reading my genuine and helpful review including what I personally believe are great suggestions list for this software, and I hope you have a great day.
